intro: Armeria vulgaris subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the common thrift, is a perennial plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. This species is well adapted to coastal and arid environments due to its drought-resistant nature.
